intro: Browningia altissima, commonly known as the tall browningia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Its foliage is broad and evergreen, providing year-round visual interest. Browningia altissima is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
